subject: Philosophy
title: How to Argue Well
description: A quick win: understand How to Argue Well.

hook.text: Most arguments are about winning. The best arguments are about learning. That changes everything.

buildup.text: Good arguing means: state your case clearly, listen generously, and update your views when evidence demands it.

discovery.text: Ask: what evidence would change my mind? If nothing could, you're not reasoning â€” you're defending a position.

twist.text: The strongest sign of a good thinker isn't being right. It's being willing to be wrong.

climax.text: Logic, charity, humility, and evidence: together they form the backbone of every productive conversation.

punchline.text: The goal of argument isn't to win. It's to get closer to truth.

quiz.question: What distinguishes a productive argument from a destructive one?
options: Willingness to update beliefs based on evidence
